intro: Coelocarpum madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It is a climbing shrub belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, yellow to orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
